main event: A UFO was observed in St. Louis, Mo on 12 Nov 52 at 2350 EST for approximately 30 minutes. The object appeared round, made no sound, and no discernible features were noted.
interesting points: The unidentified object was described as being the size of a pinhead and of starlight or blue-white color.
It was observed at an estimated 50 degrees above the horizon and had a flight pattern that varied from straight to maneuvering, including angular changes in speed and direction.
The object disappeared from view at a speed estimated to be around one thousand miles per hour and was in sight for approximately 2 minutes.
The observation was made by an 11-year-old and his parents while driving between Cedar Hill and High Ridge, MO on Highway 30, making the reliability of the observation unsure.

A preliminary analysis was deemed impossible due to the sketchy nature of the information reported, and the possibility of it being attributable to a flight test of a jet aircraft under the cloak of darkness was suggested.
sighted object: a round UFO with no discernible features and of starlight or blue-white color
